title: 103_hr4981
content: The "Civil Rights Procedures Protection Act of 1994" amends Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to establish exclusive powers and procedures for claims under this title, unless the claimant voluntarily chooses arbitration or another procedure. It also amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include exclusive powers and procedures for claims, unless the claimant voluntarily chooses arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 4 amends the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 to establish exclusive procedures for claims under section 501, unless the claimant opts for arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 5 amends the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. SEC. 5 amends the Americans With Disabilities Act of 1990 by establishing exclusive powers and procedures for claims unless the claimant chooses arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 6 amends Section 1977 of the Revised Statutes of the United States to establish exclusive procedures for claims related to the right to make and enforce a contract of employment, unless the claimant voluntarily chooses arbitration or another procedure. Section 6(d) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to establish exclusive procedures for claims related to violation of this subsection, unless the claimant voluntarily chooses arbitration or another procedure. Additionally, the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 is amended to include a section on the exclusivity of remedies. SEC. 406 of the Act establishes exclusive procedures for claims based on rights provided under the Act, unless the claimant voluntarily opts for arbitration or another procedure. SEC. 9 amends Title 9 of the United States Code to exclude claims of unlawful discrimination in employment based on specified factors. SEC. 10 specifies the application of these amendments. The amendments made by this Act will apply to claims arising on and after the enactment date.
